name: ONAP DCAE
description: Data Collection Analytics and Events (DCAE) is the data collection and analysis subsystem of ONAP. Its functions include among other things the collection of measurement and fault data from the network entities (Virtual Network Functions, Physical Network Functions, etc).  It provides also a framework for the normalization of data format, the transportation of data, analysis of data, and generations of ONAP events which can be received by other ONAP components such as Policy for subsequent operations like closed loops.

name: ONAP AAI UI
description:
The ONAP AAI UI is a service that interacts with ONAP AAI and provides users with a user interface to view and analyze AAI data. The main goal behind AAI UI is to provide a clear and user friendly view of ONAP AAI data.

The AAI UI is a small eco-system that is composed of a few micro-services.
sparky-fe is the front end portion (and not captured in the current project)  
sparky-be is the web server that serves the front-end
data-router is responsible for reading messages on a queue from AAI and keep the secondary database in sync
search-data-service is an abstraction service that interacts with the secondary database
router-core is a library containing the core camel components for the data router

internationalization_justification: It is not applicable at this point in time as the software will only be used by technical people and not by general public
maintenance_or_update_justification: All major releases are tagged in gerrit and the artifacts are stored with the release information on onap.nexus. So we can access all old versions of the artifact. If and when a upgrade requires certain steps to be followed they are being added to the release documents as needed
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Vulnerabilities can be reported using the link https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6591711 Currently we dont have any vulnerabilities reported, but the wiki page explains on how to report a vulnerability and how to report anonymously if you do not want the credit for it.
coding_standards_justification: Google coding style is used in ONAP https://github.com/google/styleguide
build_standard_variables_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_preserve_debug_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_non_recursive_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_repeatable_justification: All releases are tagged in gerrit(git), and the builds are controlled using jenkins. By providing the git tag information the same image can be build over and over again with same bit-for-bit result.
installation_standard_variables_justific: Docker containers are used for installation, so the conventions of the host operating system are not relevant.
installation_development_quick_justifica: All the components require only java and maven to begin with for a developer to quickly install and test it. Even for deployment using OOM and the right amount of resources, we can deploy the full AAI/ONAP suite in less than a day. The steps are documented in https://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submodules/oom.git/docs/oom_quickstart_guide.html
external_dependencies_justification: External dependencies are controlled using the pom file, which can be found in the root folder for the projects
dependency_monitoring_justification: We use sonatype CLM https://nexus-iq.wl.linuxfoundation.org/ and https://sonar.onap.org
updateable_reused_components_justificati:
Maven is used to manage external component versions, and the automated Jenkins build jobs will ensure the deployable artifacts are up to date with the maven changes.

Updating an external component simply involves making an update to the pom.xml file for that project.
interfaces_current_justification: We choose free open source solutions in every case and choose up-to-date versions of the components.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: https://jenkins.onap.org - on every commit, a verification job runs which runs an automated test suite. The code check in cannot pass with out jenkins posting a +1 on the review.
regression_tests_added50_justification: We add tests in these cases.
test_statement_coverage80_justification: AAI is working toward additional coverage but lack of resources prevent us from acheiving it: https://sonar.onap.org
test_policy_mandated_justification: Contributing guide lines for development is recorded in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
implement_secure_design_justification: AAI strives to implement secure design principles. We encrypt data where possible, and run security scans on the code and its dependencies.
input_validation_justification: The project strives to validate all input
crypto_credential_agility_justification: Credentials are separate and can be replaced without code compilation.
assurance_case_justification: Will work on this for next release
